meanings.definition: To make someone or something less human or civilized.
meanings.sent1: The cruel treatment imbrutes the animals in the circus.
meanings.sent2: The war imbrutes the soldiers, changing them forever.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous monkeys imbruted the elegant tea party by swinging from the chandeliers.
meanings.sent4: The harsh environment imbrutes the once lush landscape, turning it into a barren wasteland.
meanings.sent5: The dark magic of the curse slowly imbrutes the prince, transforming him into a beastly creature.

meanings.sent1: The dictator's oppressive regime imbrutes the citizens, stripping away their freedoms.
meanings.sent2: The violent video game imbrutes the players, desensitizing them to real-world violence.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous children imbruted the peaceful garden by trampling the flowers in their game of tag.
meanings.sent4: The toxic relationship imbrutes the once vibrant personalities of the couple, leaving them bitter and resentful.
meanings.sent5: The haunting memories of the past slowly imbrute his mind, eroding his sense of self.
